lead_paragraph: Matt Nagy threw for five touchdowns and ran for two more, and the visiting Columbus Destroyers held off a late rally by the Georgia Force to win the Arena Football League’s National Conference championship, 66-56.The Destroyers (10-9) advanced to the ArenaBowl for the first time. They will meet the San Jose SaberCats for the title in New Orleans. The host SaberCats advanced to their third ArenaBowl in six seasons with a 61-49 victory over the defending champion Chicago Rush. The top-seeded SaberCats (15-3) won their 12th straight game and were unbeaten at home.
